headline: Cajun Chicken Pasta
description: Cajun chicken pasta is a winner: Rich and nicely spiced, with tender chicken breast strips, bell peppers, and mushrooms in a flavorful cream sauce.

video.description: Dinner is ready in under an hour with this Cajun-spiced chicken pasta.
video.name: Cajun Chicken Pasta

name: Cajun Chicken Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain.
Cut chicken breast into strips. Place chicken and Cajun seasoning in a plastic bag. Shake to coat.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook, stirring, until browned and almost cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add bell peppers, mushrooms, and green onion. Cook, stirring, 2 to 3 minutes.
Reduce the heat and stir in cream, basil, lemon pepper, salt, garlic powder, and black pepper. Heat through. Add cooked linguine, toss, and heat through.

review.reviewBody: Very delicious! One of my favorite chicken pasta meals. Nice variety of vegetables and the cream makes a nice smooth sauce.
Really satisfying and full of flavor, this recipe is a perfect winter season dish. I made mine with a little pinch of cayenne pepper to give it a bit of extra kick.
This was very good. I doubled the spice and used half and half as well as squeezed lemon. No mushrooms added since we don't like them. Will be making this again.
Can substitute chicken with shrimp!

I've been making this recipe for years! It's easy and such a crowd pleaser. I made it often enough for my girls that they say "it smells like home!" Perfect as is, but you can add andouille sausage for a little extra protein and spice. I also like to thicken my sauce up a bit by adding a cornstarch slurry at the end and bringing to a simmer. Add to your bookmarks and enjoy!

Great recipe overall. I did do a couple of things differently. All fresh herbs and fresh lemon juice. No mushroom but added cherry tomatoes. I also added a little pasta water to help the sauce. Very flavorful! Will make again!
I thought this dish tasted pretty good. It had decent flavor. I probably would use fewer peppers next time just because there were quite a bit.

This was Amazing! I added extra Cajun seasoning at the end only cuz we like it like that. My neighbor wanted more mushrooms - so I’ll add more next time. Other than that it was great! Thank you for sharing!

the first time i made this was for husband and his brother (his wife was in hosp). next time was when SIL's brother was visiting sis in hosp, and i sent some to hosp with my BIL for HIS BIL, and even tho SIL couldn't eat any of it she said it smelled amazing! sadly SIL passed away from cancer without ever tasting it. :-( but both men LOVED it!! it's easy to make and doesn't take long at all. but instead of using a bag to coat the chicken, i sprinkled it on the cut-up chicken while it was sauteing in the pan. that way i use up every bit of seasoning! i've also made this with shrimp many times and it's equally as tasty! the recipe says serves 2, but we had enough for 4 people. this is in my regular repertoire now!

Like some others- evaporated 2% milk instead of cream since I can’t tolerate fatty dishes. Lemon juice ( 1/2-3/4 tsp) not lemon pepper, not big fan of peppers but kept mushrooms & LOVED addition of thin stalks asparagus. Used minimal amounts margarine to sauté some garlic & a tablespoon of red onion that I then sautéed the chicken in. No Parmesan needed ( & trying to lower fat as much as possible. I didn’t feel sauce needed to be thick. My own personal preference..

I made this dish for my parents and they absolutely loved it. I substituted 1 pound of deveined and peeled shrimp for the chicken. I'm not a big fan of bell peppers so I used more mushrooms and 1/2 a pound of asparagus, cut into 1 inch chunks with a bit of longer saute. I had a cup of parmesan & pecorino romano blend cheese in the fridge so I used that instead of just parmesan. Dad still raves about this so I'll be making it again this weekend, just in time for the return of football.
I did not change a thing. It was very simple and easy to make. I loved it.

Great recipe. I made it for my family and everybody loved it, cleaned the pan clean. Only thing I will change next time is I will add some shrimp. This recipe will definitely be in our dinner rotation!!!
Came out amazing. Great recipe!
I added shrimp and forgot the mushrooms
Great receipe-yes to fresh garlic, and my favorite addition in addition to cajun seasoning was Trader Joes Chile lime seasoning.
Changed one thing....substituted grape tomatoes for mushrooms.....son doesn't like mushrooms. Came out very good.

Wow! So much flavor and easy to make. Inexpensive as well! Changes I made were half of a lemon juiced instead of lemon pepper, fresh basil instead of dried, and about half a cup of pasta water stirred in before serving. Wow my mouth is still watering. And I used Tony Chacheres creole seasoning. I highly recommend. This would be easy to improvise and use shrimp . Can serve over pasta or rice. Bon Appetite!
Nice kick. Not hot but nice amount of spice. Made as recipe suggests and the result was a flavorful meal. Will definitely make again!
Made this last night! Absolutely delicious! I don't particularly like mushrooms so I just left them out.

I don’t eat chicken, so I made this with 1.25 pounds of medium sized deveined shrimp in shells, adding them just two minutes before the cream since that’s all the time they need to cook. The dish was delicious, for 4 of us (2 Teens/2 Adults) with only a small amount of the shrimp and vegetables left over. I also cooked 1 lb of linguini, mixing in about 6-8 oz, rather than just 4 oz, and serving the rest dressed with olive oil and parmesano for the teens to supplement! That all disappeared!
I used half and half instead of heavy cream and it was delicious
This is a fabulous recipe! I’ve made it many many times Comes together in 15 -20 mins. Don’t hesitate it’s a keeper
Very good and tasty! Also a bit spicy! I added shrimp and instead of red bell pepper, I used yellow bell pepper!
Made with coconut and 2%. Added Wondra and butter to thicken. Careful not to overcook chicken.
This was very good. I did tweak it just a little bit because I like things very spicy. I will make this many more times. Thank you for sharing the recipe.
Followed the directions except I toned Dow the spicy Bess a bit. It was wonderful.
I make mine a lot like this. The difference is, I use green onions and sun dried tomatoes instead of the red and green bell peppers. My family loves it with garlic bread.

Amazing recipe! The whole family enjoyed it and said it was reataurant quality. I substituted minced garlic in place of garlic powder because I always do that and made it with shrimp instead of chicken and rigatoni instead of linguini because that is what I had on hand. I dont think my changes were significant enough to makr it taste much different than following the recipe exactly. It is pretty vesitile and tweakable to individual preferences. Highly recommend!

This is very similar to a recipe that I have made for over 40 years and have prepared it for our host as far away as Australia and other parts of the world that we have visited because I know how to make it from memory. One major thing that I have changed is to use Sour Cream instead of heavy cream, much better flavor Eddie Wightman Islamorada, Florida Keys
Added 1 tsp olive oil, & juice from 1/8th Lemon to Marinade the Chicken. Substituted 1 oz creme cheese for Cream. Fresh Basil. Pasta water to thicken sauce as needed, about 1/4 cup.
No changes except for using fresh spices, this was simple and very good.
I’ve made this several times & it’s always a winner.

This pasta was such a great weeknight meal! So easy to make and it was delicious! The only things I did differently: jarred garlic instead of powder, added more Cajun seasoning than called for, and cooked the chicken entirely and then set aside to rest while I cooked the vegetables and sauce. Adding the chicken at the end made it easier to slice and divvy up.

This has become a staple at home - in the rotation almost every other week - and on a month-long trip to India I introduced it to my team who were astounded at how flavorful it was. (And that's saying something!) I crank up the amount of Cajun seasoning and use almost twice the amount of mushrooms. It refrigerates and reheats well, so I make enough for two meals.

I've made this several times and love it. I was going to make for a fishing trip. Would anyone know if you have make the chicken/sauce and leave it in a slow cooker for a few hours and make/add the pasta a few hours later?

This was great! I made a few minor changes: Used an orange pepper instead of red and 1/4 tsp of the garlic powder and black pepper instead of 1/8 tsp. I also didn't add any Parmesan cheese. I did use fresh linguine, which I highly recommend. Ultimately, the flavors in this were great, but pretty mild. The parmesan would probably help, and I would also potentially add another 1/4 tsp cajun spice to the heavy cream mixture.

It was delicious. I also cubed the chicken and used salt free Cajun seasoning. I didn’t have milk or cream so I added just a heaping tablespoon of sour cream and it was delectably creamy. Will make again.

I found the flavors to be a bit confusing. The texture of the sauce also didn't seem to come together quite right for me, it started out too liquidy so I cooked it a bit longer and then it broke. So I definitely messed that last part up myself, but not sure why it didn't absorb well to begin with. I honestly was tempted to go with 2 stars but upped it since my husband really liked it, and he usually hates things with veggies!
I would definitely make it again. Very good
I love it so much

This recipe is the bomb! Me and my mom double it! The guys on the tug boat love it! It's even got me out of work because they would rather me cook it and they finish the tow work. I don't care about the calories because that's why it tastes so darn good!

I love this recipe and have cooked it many, many times for my family. It is also delicious when prepared with twice the amount of sauce, dumped into a crock pot, topped with fresh parmesan cheese, and cooked on low for a couple of hours. It becomes a DELICIOUS creamy casserole and the browned edges are to die for. I made this for a holiday potluck at work before covid and it was a huge hit.
my husband and i really enjoy this recipe

Holy cow! This was delish! I cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and, because I was out of bags, I seasoned it (using Slap Ya Mama Cajun Seasoning) while it was cooking. I used half and half with some cornstarch (it was what I had and needed to finish). Hubs raved. So good! We decided to add a dash of Slap Ya Mama to the finished dish after a few bites and what a flavor explosion! Definitely a keeper recipe!
Sorry, I just thought it was OK. Not worth a 2nd try. To me it needed more pop.

This one's a keeper. I used chicken tenders and Aw seasoning which is like a mixture of Cajun and Mexican seasoning. Removed the chicken from the pan while I cooked the peppers mixture. (for a little longer than 3 minutes). Doubled all the spices at the end and I added extra heavy cream. It was runny but it thickened with a little time. And of course, I used a heavy, cast iron skillet. Delicious and not very difficult at all. Hubby loved it too.

Delicious! Picky husband said this is a KEEPER! Adjustments made: I used 1/2 & 1/2 instead of heavy cream (I'm not a fan of heavy cream) and used my diy Cajun seasoning (rather do diy instead of buying a container). After adding all ingredients to pan sprinkled with more Cajun seasoning. Delicious!!
I reduced the salt and combined all the spices to coat the chicken. The seasoned chicken was left to marinade for a few hours. I then added a small amount of spice to the sauce. It was really good!
Followed directions as provided except used shrimp instead of chicken. What a wonderful dish! Will be part of my meal lineup going forward.
So good and so easy! I used chicken thighs (because that is what I had) and also half and half instead of heavy cream. Very tasty dish that comes together really quickly.

Yup, it's a keeper! My picky husband also ate it right up! The only alteration I made was another tablespoon of the Cajun seasoning and 3 cloves of fresh garlic that I happened to have in my cupboard, crushed and minced.

This is super yummy. I dredged the chicken in sifted floor and Cajun spices (blackening) and the chicken came out with a zest light crust. Also used fresh garlic that I added with the veggies. Don't be shy with the spices and butter. I imagine the variations of this recipe are endless. Will try mixing and matching sausage and shrimp with the chicken in future.
This recipe was delicious and will make it again. Followed the directions except for two things that didn't really change it. Didn't have any mushrooms and I used fresh garlic. Thank you for sharing!
I followed the recipe as written, and even my finicky eaters loved it

Soo Scrumptious! Even my picky 11 yr old enjoyed it. I am making more today! I used 'Slap ya Mama' Cajun Seasoning and since I'm not fond of mushrooms I omitted them. This is better tasting than the T.G.I.F version I brought a couple wks ago! Thanks for sharing! ??????

This was fabulous! The only changes made were to omit the mushrooms, sliced thinly 1 small onion and also added orange and yellow peppers. This a keeper for sure. Thank you, Carol for sharing with us.

This is a keeper. The peppers impart a really nice flavor. Season to your taste. I like to use Tony Chachere's. You can embellish the recipe all you want. But, the base is great as is. However, I do recommend adding a thickener so that the sauce will cling to the pasta.

I made this for dinner tonight as written. It was easy to make and tasty, and yes it was spicy, but not hot or burning. I used fusilli pasta (spiral) which was great for soaking up the sauce. I made it because I had the ingredients on hand, and I was looking for something that could be keto for a family member (eaten without the pasta). It is a winner and I’ll be making it again!

This recipe is amazing! I’ve made this so many times. I recently started making it with unsweetened coconut cream cus my husband is lactose intolerant (he used to just put up with it cus it’s so yummy lol) and it is so good! You can really even tell the difference. Maybe just barely less creamy but still delicious

I made it pretty much by the recipe tweaking a bit to adjust for the servings for 6. I didn't have green peepers so I used what I had(yellow, orange & red). It was really flavorful. The sauce was not too thin, it was just right. I did forget to sprinkle the cheese on top. Will definitely make it again. Everyone loved it.

Family loved it. I added half cream half chicken broth. Skipped the lemon pepper (never like that stuff), but added sautéed shallot in the beginning, and jalapeños pepper slices and fresh basil at the end.
So delicious. I added extra seasoning and some cherry tomatoes to my pan, also. Really good.

Aside from using low-fat sour cream instead of heavy cream, made as written.Simple and straight forward to put together. It was wonderful, with great flavor, I was finally able to use the Cajun spice I had in the pantry.
Loved this recipe and so did my family; even my very picky 17 year old.
The only change I made was to use Italian seasoning instead of basil for a little more flavor
Delicious!! And very easy to make. My go to pasta dish.

This is very flavorful & yummy. I didn't have Cajun seasoning on hand, so I used the Cajun Spice Mix recipe from here and I used a fresh garlic clove instead of garlic powder because I love the taste of fresh garlic. Definately a keeper!

We thought this recipe was delicious and a keeper for sure. Simple and easy to make. I did quick fry the mushrooms first as we like them browned. Used a home made Cajun seasoning. Hubby said to mark a star beside this one.
This is so tasty and easy to prepare. I added shrimp and zucchini in it. I was told not to lose this recipe!!
Easy and delicious!

I have made many recipes on this site but I felt compelled to review this specific one because it was so good!
I used light cream in replace of the heavy cream, left out the lemon pepper and black pepper and used a small can of mushrooms. I added seasoned salt instead of the regular table salt because this is a staple seasoning for me and added dried oregano along with the dried basil. I also made my own cajun seasoning as recommended by another reviewer and that worked out great. Leaving out black pepper was a good idea because the heat from the cajun seasoning was enough and glad I made that decision.
I saved some pasta water just in case I needed to thin out the sauce but I was pleased because I didn't need to use a slurry for thickening but did use the pasta water for a little extra moisture.
This dish had amazing flavor and this will be a recipe I will make again.

Made it as directed except added a little more than described spice measurements. Also added mozzarella to help thicken the sauce. After letting sit for about 10 minutes, sauce thickened up nicely. Would def make again!
Came out perfect. I did add shrimp to the recipe and a little cayenne pepper to spice it up a little more. 10/10 would recommend
Love this one. Make it a lot but we use mini farfalle instead of linguine.
Excellent recipe my family loved it ? was quick and easy to prepare and delicious ??we will definitely make this recipe again
We loved it! I will definitely make it again!
So good! Tons of flavor. Great with shrimp too. Served with a green salad and crusty bread. Everyone went back for seconds!
my kids loved this

My son LOVES this dish . We substituted shrimp for chicken because that is his favorite. My only comment is to cut the amount of salt to a fraction of what is called for in the recipe. Otherwise way too salty . Thanks !
We LOVED this recipe!!!
Very good pasta and simple to make
We had this for dinner last night and it was amazing!! I made it with shrimp instead of chicken and it was so, so good! I plan to make it again, maybe next time I will do a shrimp and chicken combo.

I added in extra shrimp and andoulle sausage. I also sauteed the vegetables a couple minutes and some garlic.

My picky family loved it! Next time, I'll take a picture and post. RIght now, it's gone!

I made this the 1st time exactly as written. I would give it 3 stars as is but we didn’t love the cream sauce, though the flavors were good. I made changes the 2nd time and we loved it. First I used a rotisserie chicken out of laziness. I tossed it with the Cajun seasoning then added it to the sautéed veggies along with fresh garlic. Instead of the cream I added about 1 cup of chicken broth and 1/2 cup of white wine. I added fresh basil along with the salt, pepper and lemon pepper. I also added juice from 1 lemon. I thickened the sauce a bit with corn starch before tossing in the fettuccine- I increased the pasta to 8 oz. Delicious and 5 stars.
Great recipe, the only change I made was to the bell peppers I used, yellow, red, and orange! My family loved it.

Although admittedly this recipe was a touch too intricate for weekday meals, it is absolutely delicious and filling! Full of fresh and healthy ingredients and satisfies most picky eaters. Would be good for special occasions or guests.

This was SOOOO good!! My creamy sauces never turn out right but I keep on trying to find the right recipe and this is it!!!! I made it as written and just added some shredded mozzarella cheese at the end to thicken I the sauce a bit. Loved it.

I've been trying to do things in the kitchen I've never done before since COVID. This recipe was calling to me. Mind you, I tweak to make it my own. I nixed the onion and mushroom (picky husband), used only a 1/2 cup of heavy cream and added 1/2 tsp of cornstarch to thicken it up. Same seasonings though. My husband loved it and he ONLY eats red sauce. So, I call it a win!! Thanks for the recipe.
Oh my gosh! This was so good. I cooked this as written. I wouldn't change a thing. Quick and super simple. I will definitely be cooking this one again.

I enjoyed it!!
I ended up even homemaking the cajun seasoning! 
even substituting (because I forgot to grab a few ingredients ft. lemon pepper) it still tasted pretty great!
this was quick , easy, and can add anything to the recipe to make it your own
Everyone in the family loved this! It's not spicy so if you want spice you'll need to add some. Great flavors though!

Changed the servings to 4. Great recipe, very authentic and tastes better than what you'd get if you ordered this at a restuarant. I removed the chicken from the pan while making the cream with only the veggies in the pan, then added back the chicken. Keep the chicken foil tented while dealing with reducing the sauce so it stays nice and tender. That being said, the recipe takes longer to make than stated if you take a few extra (but I feel necessary) steps.
I cook this by popular vote by my clients. Most of my clients can’t take the heat. So I made cajon seasoning that was not hot. It is very good and easy.

I made this for the first time and will make this again. I think this is a little tame for my taste so I plan to add a little more Cajun seasoning. I did use half and half as I did not have heavy cream in the house. I added 1/2 the parmigian cheese to the sauce along with a handful of shredded mozzarella cheese and it thickened up beautifully.

This is an excellent dish, added fresh shrimp along with 2 pieces of cooked chicken, cut into bite size pieces. Wanted to make a sauce, no cream used 1/4 C half and half (it’s what I had on hand) then added: chicken broth by eye, 4oz of cream cheese and kept stirring until all melted, added the shrimp then added the cooked spaghetti....corrected the seasoning,

This was good but I’m a little confused about the pasta ratio. The original recipe calls for only 1/4 box. I used a full box of pasta, kept the chicken the same and doubled the veggies, and double the cream and spices. Maybe it’s the creole seasoning I used but it was a bit much for me and I think maybe it would have been better if I used the original spice amount even though I doubled pasta and sauce.
Love this recipe. Added a half a teaspoon of cayenne pepper to the recipe gave it just a little more spice love it. Will make it again
